thread.title: Minister has big shoes to fill: NBN chief
thread.title_full: Minister has big shoes to fill: NBN chief | Business Spectator

author: Mitchell Neems
title: Minister has big shoes to fill: NBN chief
text:
Bill Morrow, the chief executive of the National Broadband Network, has batted off questions about the prospect of Treasurer Joe Hockey shifting to the role of communications minister.
Mr Morrow was asked the question following an address to the National Press Club to discuss the NBN.
"I trust the Prime Minister that he will put a competent person in the position, whoever that is," he said.
Mr Morrow added he would like the new Communications Minister to be "somebody who believes in what we do" before lauding the work of previous communications minister and now Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.
"Working with Malcolm Turnbull has been a pleasure," he said.
Mr Morrow said he expects Mr Turnbull will appoint someone with similar capabilities to himself, particularly a curiosity for detail about the rollout and its intricacies.
Mr Turnbull is expected to unveil a new look cabinet on Monday, with Mr Hockey expected to be removed from the role of Treasurer.
